properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 3:16PM EST until February 11 at 9:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC
has issued a Flood Advisory for the French Broad River near
Fletcher affecting Buncombe and Henderson Counties...

.Another round of heavy rain will develop across the region through
tonight resulting in rising river levels once again.

The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a
* Flood Advisory for the French Broad River Near Fletcher.
* from this evening to Tuesday morning.
* At 2 PM Monday the stage was 9.4 feet.
* Action Stage is 10.0 feet.
* Minor Flood Stage is 13.0 feet.
* FORECAST: The river will rise to near 12.0 feet by early Wednesday
morning.
* IMPACTS: As the river rises from 10.0 to 12.0 feet, farmland
flooding develops from Etowah to Avery Creek. Butler Bridge Road
becomes inundated, Glenn Bridge Park river access and Westfeldt Park
will experience scattered flooding.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory for a river forecast point means that nuisance
flooding is expected to occur along the river when the river level is
forecast to be just below or at the official flood stage.
